title: https://github.com/numba/numba

last_post.content:
Hello - an #introductorytoot!

Numba is an open-source JIT Compiler for Python. It translates a subset of Python and NumPy code into optimized machine code for CPUs and CUDA using LLVM.

Installable with conda / pip:

conda install numba
pip install numba

Get started with the 5 minute guide: https://numba.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user/5minguide.html

Code is on Github: https://github.com/numba/numba

Start developing / contributing with the development guide: https://numba.readthedocs.io/en/stable/developer/index.html

Get help on Discourse: https://numba.disourse.group

title: blocklists

last_post.content:
Less than 24 hours after needing to defend to two different admins the reasons for why I create blocklists, and whether or not the names on the T0 list are "fair" or not, there's a Fediblock post from a new admin getting subjected to racist/homophobic/transmisic hate speech (it's usually a trifecta with these fucks).

Four sites and oh, look, all four are on the T0 blocklist.

I routinely have this experience watching fediblock. Someone reports something that's on the T0 list.

So here, admin, take my blocklist. I made it just for occasions like this.

Go to Moderation > Federation > Import on Mastodon to import it to your server.

https://codeberg.org/oliphant/blocklists/src/branch/main/blocklists/_unified_tier0_blocklist.csv

Disclaimer: I am not god, so feel free to double-check anything on this list you want. If you disagree with anything on the list--uncheck that option before import.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Deprecating the Peek project · Issue #1191 · phw/peek

last_post.content:
Today I learned that the maintainer of #Peek, the #GIFRecording tool, stopped working on it in January. It wasn't working in my computer for a while. https://github.com/phw/peek/issues/1191 This is a bit sad, but one has to be grateful for the time while it worked. Wonderful interface. Lots of my skech-a-day posts, tutorials and support sessions with students benefited from a #GIF made with it.

I've been using Blue Recorder on and off and decided to try #pypeek https://github.com/firatkiral/pypeek today, it looks promising.

I also have some PNG to GIF #Pillow scripts to use with #py5 https://github.com/villares/sketch-a-day/blob/main/admin_scripts/pngs_to_gif.py because it gives me more control than using the py5 export tool: https://py5coding.org/reference/py5tools_animated_gif.html
(I like to decide myself when to add frames, start, stop, skip)

title: Web-based protocol handlers

last_post.content:
Good morning. It still looks like rain, it's also time to get my 💡 thinking about comment control, showing all replies, account migration, reducing server load, federating likes, and what not out of my brain. It's a true incompatible to the current FediVerse ActivityPub extension.

Before the list, lots of good stuff happening for Web-based protocol handlers @ fediverse-ideas. I'll also be adding this to fediverse-ideas.

💡A Conversation is a new type of ActivityPub object, that is Hosted by a single Actor.

💡Actors Contribute to the Conversation by sending the the corresponding content to the Host.

💡The Host's task is to distribute and store the Conversation. Host may aggregate stuff before distributing, e.g. for emoji reactions.

💡Host has "moderation privilege". Contributors are allowed to invite actors to contribute.

💡Contributors may "walk away" and start the conversation elsewhere.

💡🛠️ Contributions are signed. Contributions can be updated including the attributedTo field with proper signatures (allows for portable accounts).

💡🛠️ Contributions' ids are assigned by the user as a globally unique fragment to the conversation.

title: Support Post Migration · Issue #12423 · mastodon/mastodon

last_post.content:
I’m very excited to see the discussion for the @Mastodon post migration issue has picked back up. This is probably the single largest gap between rhetoric and reality on #Mastodon.

It’s anecdata, but *every singe person* I mention account migration to immediately asks “oh, so my posts can move with me.” This is, unfortunately, immidiately followed up with disappointment that their posts stay behind. Coupled with the recent push to make mastodon.social the default for the iOS app… we need a way for users to move around SEAMLESSLY. We can make all the technical excuses we want, but if the process doesn’t work it’s not really account migration.

Until we have post support, we should probably say we have “social graph” migration, not “account migration,” or we’re really just lying and setting up people to be let down.

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/12423

title: GitHub - dirkschumacher/transduceR: transducers in R

last_post.content:
While R isn't my favorite language of the ones I regularly use, I know you #rstats people adore it, so here's a fun package you should try out:

https://github.com/dirkschumacher/transduceR

If you like functional style, but want efficiency too, try out transducers, they're an amazing little tool that I'm still picking up, but they give you pipelines that don't create intermediate arrays (and composable reductions, lazy evaluation in this case, etc). Thus, they still provide clean, familiar functional syntax but with a pretty sizable performance boost!

Here's a conceptual primer on them from Clojure as well:

https://clojure.org/reference/transducers

I hope this proves useful to some of you! 😁

title: gist.github.com/postspectacula...

last_post.content:
I just released #Bubblemania, my first #GenerativeArt project on #FXHash in over 9 months and a little gift to some in the growing #GenerativeArt community here on Mastodon and to other randomly chosen collectors of my previous pieces.

https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/26702

This small project is several things:

1. First and foremost, it's a little, light "visual ASMR" treat to bring some positivity into your day - some "Maluma" softness to contrast the more common "Takete" of contemporary generative art aesthetics[1].

2. A small gift to celebrate the fledgling generative art/design community on Mastodon: 20 of the 128 tokens are given to some of the people in that slowly growing community, with the remainder given as Thank You (and smoke signal/sign of life) to some of my existing collectors, randomly chosen via lottery script[2].

3. For those so inclined, and with a bit of hand-holding, ChatGPT explains the _true_ conceptual depths of this project much better than I ever could:

"The bubbles in this generative art piece serve as a reflection of the human experience, reminding us of our own impermanence and the ephemeral nature of all things. The piece invites us to contemplate the fundamental questions of human existence and speaks to our innate curiosity and desire to understand the world around us.

Through the convergence of science and art, this piece reveals the infinite complexity and unpredictability of the world while also hinting at the underlying order that exists within the chaos of the universe. It reminds us that even in the midst of uncertainty, there is beauty and order to be found, and that it is through the pursuit of knowledge and understanding that we can find meaning and purpose in our lives."

Isn't that lovely & who can argue with that?! :)

4. I often revisit projects/ideas after many years, mainly to re-examine them with new eyes/knowledge/tools and/or to get answers/verification which I couldn't get earlier. This is one of these instances. So for the more rational-minded, this is a TypeScript/GLSL (WebGL) version of an older Clojure/Houdini project (from 2016) to generate a Voronoi via the simulation of intersecting sphere meshes (aka foam bubbles). In this new version the sim & deformations are done in realtime (~4M vertices, mainly via vertex shader). Also added some _basic_ physics and procedural textures to create more of a quirky character (hopefully complemented by the different color themes and other params).

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bouba/kiki_effect
[2] https://gist.github.com/postspectacular/3d970e02570b7dfd32d03d43e1e7e3e0
